questions.q: Which of the following is the most common cause of acute vision loss in elderly patients?
questions.explanation: Age-related macular degeneration is the leading cause of vision loss in elderly patients

questions.q: What is the most appropriate initial treatment for acute bacterial conjunctivitis?
questions.explanation: Topical antibiotics are the first-line treatment for bacterial conjunctivitis

questions.q: A client 12 weeks pregnant comes to the emergency department with abdominal cramping and moderate vaginal bleeding. Speculum exams reveals 2-3 cm dilatation, the nurse would document these findings as which of the following
questions.explanation: Imminent abortion also called spontaneous abortion is the death of the fetus before it can even survive. The most common symptom of miscarriage is vaginal bleeding with or without pain

questions.q: Indomethacin can be used in the treatment of polyhydramnios. What class of drug is it?
questions.explanation: Indomethacin is an NSAID

questions.q: Which of these is not a risk factor of uterine rupture?
questions.explanation: Macrosomia, a short delivery interval and maternal age >40 years old have all been shown to increase the risk of uterine rupture. Obstetric cholestasis has not been shown to increase the risk of uterine rupture

questions.q: In the most common form of shoulder dystocia, what does the anterior fetal shoulder become impacted against?
questions.explanation: The anterior fetal shoulder is impacted by the pubic symphysis

questions.q: Which of the following is not a risk factor of VTE?
questions.explanation: Hyperemesis gravidarum is not a risk factor for VTE

questions.q: Which of the following is not a recognised symptom of uterine fibroid?
questions.explanation: Uterine fibroid can rarely present with acute pelvic pain but do not present with cyclical pain

questions.q: Which point during pregnancy carries the greatest risk for VTE?
questions.explanation: The risk of VTE in pregnancy is caused by changes in levels of proteins in the clotting cascade. These changes are more pronounced as pregnancy progresses, with the highest risk of VTE occurring in the post-partum period

questions.q: Which of these is a significant risk factor for miscarriage?
questions.explanation: Increased maternal age is a strong risk factor for miscarriage due to the increase number of chromosomally abnormal ova

questions.q: What is the usual first line therapy in lichen sclerosis?
questions.explanation: The underlying etiology of lichens sclerosis is thought to be autoimmune so the first line treatment is topical immunosuppression through steroid creams e.g clobetasol propionate

questions.q: What is primary dysmenorrhea?
questions.A: Menstrual pain that occurs in the menopause
questions.B: Menstrual pain with no underlying pelvic pathology
questions.C: Menstrual pain with an identifiable cause
questions.D: Excessive menstrual loss which interferes with a womanâ€™s quality of life
questions.explanation: Primary dysmenorrhea is menstrual pain with no underlying pelvic pathology

questions.q: What is the standard initial treatment for iron deficiency anemia?
questions.explanation: Oral iron supplementation is the first line management of iron deficiency anemia

questions.q: Which of the following is not a risk factor for anemia in pregnancy?
questions.explanation: DM is not a risk factor for anemia in pregnancy

questions.q: Which of the following is the greatest risk factor for uterine rupture?
questions.explanation: Previous uterine surgery is a risk factor for uterine rupture but previous cesarean section is a stronger risk factor

questions.q: Which of the following is not a common symptom of cervical ectropion?
questions.explanation: Cervical ectropion is most commonly asymptomatic. It occasionally presents with post coital bleeding and others but does not typically cause painful periods

questions.q: Which of the following surgical procedures are used to treat heavy menstrual bleeding without an attributable cause?
questions.explanation: Myomectomy and uterine artery embolization are only used in the treatment of HMB secondary to fibroids. An oophorectomy is not a treatment of HMB

questions.q: Which syndrome describes intra uterine adhesions?
questions.explanation: Asherman syndrome is an acquired condition causing intra uterine adhesions and can be caused by surgery of the uterus, pelvic infections or treatment of cancer. It can also be a complication of manual vacuum aspiration

questions.q: What is the main presenting symptom of miscarriage?
questions.explanation: Vaginal bleeding is the main presenting symptom of miscarriage

questions.q: Which type of breech presentation is where both legs are flexed at the hips and the knees?
questions.explanation: Complete breech presents with both legs flexed at the hips and the knees

questions.q: Which condition produces a microcytic anemia?
questions.explanation: Iron deficiency can lead to microcytic anemia. Thalassemia, anemia of chronic disease, sideroblastic anemia, lead poisoning can all lead to microcytic anemia

questions.q: Which of the following is a common symptom of a cervical polyp?
questions.explanation: If symptomatic, the most common clinical feature is abnormal vaginal bleeding

questions.q: Which of the following is a direct complication of oligohydramnios?
questions.explanation: Oligohydramnios decreases the fetal ability to move in utero which can lead to the development of severe muscle contractures

questions.q: In a woman with drug-managed gestational diabetes, what are the recommendations for delivery?
questions.D: Allow the pregnancy to prolong and do not induce
questions.explanation: Women who have gestational diabetes should aim to deliver at 37-38 weeks if they are on pharmacological management. They would be advised to consider induction of labor or cesarean section before 40+6 weeks if they are managing gestational diabetes with diet alone

questions.q: What is the recommended treatment for anti-phospholipid syndrome during pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Live birth rate in women with anti-phospholipid syndrome who do not receive pharmacological intervention has been reported to be as low as 15%, so management with an anticoagulant and platelet agent is recommended. Warfarin is contraindicated in pregnancy due to its teratogenicity

questions.q: The Expected date of delivery of a human pregnancy can be calculated:
questions.A: From a change in the patient's weight.
questions.B: As 10 lunar months after the time of ovulation.
questions.C: As 40 weeks after last menstrual period.
questions.D: As 280 days from the last full moon.
questions.E: As 36 weeks after the last menstrual period.
questions.explanation: The EDD is calculated using Naegeleâ€™s rule: LMP - 3 months + 7 days

questions.q: The last menstrual period was June 30. The expected date of delivery (EDD) is approximately:
questions.explanation: Using Naegeleâ€™s rule

questions.q: Uterine Cervix:
questions.A: Is the portion of the uterus below the isthmus
questions.B: External OS cell lining is columnar epithelium
questions.C: Laterally is attached to the round ligament
questions.D: The cervical canal is covered with stratified squamous epithelium
questions.E: Can be dilated with dilators without the need of anesthesia
questions.explanation: Uterine cervix is the portion of the uterus below the isthmus

questions.q: The main support of the uterus is provided by:
questions.explanation: The cardinal ligament is the main support for the uterus

questions.q: The most important muscle in the pelvic floor is:
questions.explanation: Levator ani muscle is the most important muscle of the pelvic floor

questions.q: The pelvis includes which of the following bones:
questions.A: Trochanter, hip socket, ischium, sacrum & pubis.
questions.explanation: The pelvis is made up of ilium, ischium, pubis, sacrum, and coccyx
